00030 struct zerodata_t: public data_t {
00031     public:
00032     zerodata_t() { copies=1; fixed_mask=0; length=max_length=1; *magnitude=0; }
00033 };
00034 
00035 zerodata_t* zerodata() {
00036     static std::auto_ptr<zerodata_t> z(new zerodata_t);
00037     return z.get();

00042 base_integer::base_integer(): flags(0), data(0) { }

00044 base_integer::base_integer(const base_integer& c, bool fixed): flags(0), data(0)
00045 {
00046     if (fixed) flags |= flag_fixedlength;
00047     _attach(c);

00050 base_integer::base_integer(size_t count, digit_t mask): flags(flag_fixedlength),
00051     data(0)
00052 {
00053     _base_attach(allocate_fixed(mask, count, 1));
00054 }

00056 base_integer::base_integer(data_t *adopt, bool neg): flags(0), data(0) {
00057     if (adopt && adopt->fixed_mask != 0) flags |= flag_fixedlength;
00058     _base_attach(adopt);
00059     _set_negative(neg);
00060 }

00062 base_integer::~base_integer() {
00063     if (data && --data->copies == 0) deallocate(data);
00064 }

00066 digit_t base_integer::_get_digit(size_t index) const {
00067     return data->magnitude[index];
00068 }
00069 
00070 digit_t base_integer::_get_digit(size_t index, bool) const {
00071     if (index >= data->length) return 0;
00072     return data->magnitude[index];
00073 }

00075 digit_t* base_integer::_get_writable_digits() {
00076     assert(!_get_readonly());
00077     return data->magnitude;

00088 size_t base_integer::_get_max_length() const {
00089     return _is_fixed() ? _fixed_digits() : (std::numeric_limits<size_t>::max)();
00090 }

00092 void base_integer::_set_length(size_t digits) {
00093     data->length = digits;

00096 size_t base_integer::_log2() const {
00097     size_t len = _get_length() - 1;
00098     return (bits_per_digit * len) + log2(_get_digit(len));
00099 }

00101 void base_integer::_set_unsigned(boost::uintmax_t n, bool negative) {
00102     // Assumes that the proper allocation & sizing was already done
00103     assert(!_get_readonly());
00104     if (data == 0) _base_attach(allocate(detail::digits_in_uintmax));
00105     if (digit_t(n) == n) {
00106         data->length = 1;
00107         *data->magnitude = digit_t(n);
00108     } else {
00109         digit_t *i = data->magnitude, *ie = i + data->max_length;
00110         while (n != 0 && i != ie) {
00111             *i++ = digit_t(n & digit_mask);
00112             n >>= bits_per_digit;
00113         }
00114         data->length = i - data->magnitude;
00115     }
00116     _set_negative(negative);
00117     _cleanup();
00118 }
00119 
00120 void base_integer::_set_signed(boost::intmax_t n) {
00121     if (n >= 0) {
00122         _set_unsigned(n);
00123     } else if (n == (std::numeric_limits<boost::intmax_t>::min)()) {
00124         // Have to treat the minimum number carefully, because -n is not
00125         // what you'd think it is.
00126         _set_unsigned(-(n+1), true);
00127         _decrement();
00128     } else {
00129         _set_unsigned(-n, true);
00130     }
00131 }

00133 bool base_integer::_is_unique() const {
00134     return (!data || data->copies <= 1);
00135 }
00136 
00137 bool base_integer::_is_zero() const {
00138     return (data->length == 1 && *data->magnitude == 0);
00139 }
00140 
00141 bool base_integer::_is_fixed() const {
00142     if (data) return (data->fixed_mask != 0);
00143     else return ((flags & flag_fixedlength) != 0);
00144 }
00145 
00146 size_t base_integer::_fixed_digits() const {
00147     return _is_fixed() ? data->max_length : 0;
00148 }
00149 
00150 size_t base_integer::_fixed_bits() const {
00151     size_t digits = _fixed_digits();
00152     if (digits != 0) return ((digits - 1) * detail::bits_per_digit) +
00153             detail::log2(data->fixed_mask);
00154     else return 0;
00155 }

00157 bool base_integer::_get_negative() const {
00158     return ((flags & flag_negative) ? true : false);
00159 }

00161 void base_integer::_set_negative(bool neg) {
00162     if (neg) flags |= flag_negative;
00163     else flags &= ~flag_negative;

00166 void base_integer::_toggle_negative() {
00167     flags ^= flag_negative;

00171     return ((flags & flag_readonly) ? true : false);

00175     flags |= flag_readonly;

00178 void base_integer::_realloc(size_t new_digit_count) {
00179     data = reallocate(data, new_digit_count);
00180 }

00182 void base_integer::_make_unique() {
00183     if (data && !_is_unique()) {
00184         data_t *olddata = data;
00185 
00186         data = (olddata->fixed_mask != 0 ?
00187             allocate_fixed(olddata->fixed_mask, olddata->max_length, 0) :
00188             allocate(olddata->length, 0));
00189         data->copies = 1;
00190         data->length = olddata->length;
00191 
00192         digit_t *s = olddata->magnitude, *se = s + olddata->length;
00193         digit_t *t = data->magnitude;
00194         while (s != se) *t++ = *s++;
00195 
00196         --olddata->copies;
00197     }
00198 }

00200 void base_integer::_swap(base_integer& other) {
00201     flag_t tempflags = flags;
00202     flags = other.flags;
00203     other.flags = tempflags;
00204 
00205     data_t *tempdata = data;
00206     data = other.data;
00207     other.data = tempdata;
00208 }
00209 
00210 void base_integer::_base_attach(data_t *new_data, flag_t setflags, size_t
00211     extra_allocation)
00212 {
00213     #ifdef XINT_DISABLE_COPY_ON_WRITE
00214         bool adopt=(new_data && new_data->copies == 0);
00215     #else
00216         bool adopt=true;
00217     #endif
00218 
00219     if (data != new_data || extra_allocation != 0) {
00220         // If only one of them is fixed-length, the data can't be adopted.
00221         if (adopt && new_data && _is_fixed() != (new_data->fixed_mask != 0))
00222             adopt=false;
00223 
00224         // If either of them are fixed-length, and they're not the same fixed-
00225         // length, then the data can't be adopted.
00226         if (adopt && data && new_data && (data->fixed_mask ||
00227             new_data->fixed_mask) && (data->fixed_mask != new_data->fixed_mask
00228             || data->max_length != new_data->max_length)) adopt=false;
00229 
00230         // If we don't have a data item, but we're supposed to allocate extra
00231         // data, we can't adopt the existing data item.
00232         if (adopt && extra_allocation != 0 && !data) adopt=false;
00233 
00234         // If extra_allocation is requested, and it's a variable-length integer,
00235         // check the max_size. If there isn't enough to fit in the
00236         // extra_allocation, don't allow adoption.
00237         if (adopt && extra_allocation != 0 && data->fixed_mask == 0)
00238             if (data->length + extra_allocation > data->max_length) adopt=false;
00239 
00240         if (adopt) {
00241             if (data && --data->copies == 0) deallocate(data);
00242             data=new_data;
00243             if (data) ++data->copies;
00244         } else if (new_data != 0) {
00245             // Duplicate the data in a unique data_t item
00246             if (data == 0) {
00247                 data = (_is_fixed() ?
00248                     allocate_fixed(new_data->fixed_mask, new_data->max_length,
00249                         0) :
00250                     allocate(new_data->length + extra_allocation, 0));
00251                 ++data->copies;
00252             } else if ((data->copies > 1 || data->max_length < new_data->length
00253                 + extra_allocation) || _get_readonly())
00254             {
00255                 data_t *olddata = data;
00256                 data = (_is_fixed() ?
00257                     allocate_fixed(data->fixed_mask, data->max_length, 0) :
00258                     allocate(new_data->length + extra_allocation, 0));
00259                 ++data->copies;
00260                 if (--olddata->copies == 0) deallocate(olddata);
00261             }
00262             data->length = (std::min)(new_data->length + extra_allocation,
00263                 data->max_length);
00264 
00265             digit_t *s = new_data->magnitude, *se = s + new_data->length;
00266             digit_t *t = data->magnitude, *te = t + data->length;
00267             while (t != te && s != se) *t++ = *s++;
00268             zero(t, te);
00269         } else {
00270             if (--data->copies == 0) deallocate(data);
00271             data=0;
00272         }
00273     }
00274     flags = setflags;
00275 }
00276 
00277 void base_integer::_attach(const base_integer& copy) {
00278     _base_attach(copy.data, copy.flags);
00279     if (data) _cleanup();
00280 }
00281 
00282 void base_integer::_cleanup() {
00283     digit_t *p = data->magnitude + data->length - 1;
00284     if (data->fixed_mask != 0 && p == data->magnitude + data->max_length - 1)
00285         *p &= data->fixed_mask;
00286     if (*p == 0) {
00287         if (p != data->magnitude) {
00288             while (--p != data->magnitude && *p == 0); // Null loop
00289             if (*p == 0) _set_negative(false); // It's zero.
00290             data->length = p - data->magnitude + 1;
00291         } // It's zero, but it may legitimately be a "negative zero", leave it.
00292     }
00293 }
00294 
00295 integer base_integer::_to_integer() const {
00296     integer r;
00297     r._attach(*this);
00298     return r;
00299 }
00300 
00301 void base_integer::_increment(bool absolute_value) {
00302     _make_unique();
00303     if (_is_zero()) {
00304         data->magnitude[0] = 1;
00305         _set_negative(false);
00306     } else if (!absolute_value && _get_negative()) {
00307         _decrement(true);
00308     } else {
00309         _realloc(_get_length() + 1);
00310         digit_t *p = _get_writable_digits(), *pe = p + _get_length();
00311 
00312         while (p < pe) {
00313             if (*p == digit_mask) *p++ = 0;
00314             else { *p++ += 1; break; }
00315         }
00316         _cleanup();
00317     }
00318 }
00319 
00320 void base_integer::_decrement(bool absolute_value) {
00321     _make_unique();
00322     if (_is_zero()) {
00323         data->magnitude[0]=1;
00324         _set_negative(true);
00325     } else if (!absolute_value && _get_negative()) {
00326         _increment(true);
00327     } else {
00328         digit_t *p = _get_writable_digits(), *pe = p + _get_length();
00329         while (p != pe) {
00330             if (*p == 0) *p++ = digit_mask;
00331             else { *p++ -= 1; break; }
00332         }
00333         _cleanup();
00334     }
00335 }

00339 void base_variable_length_integer::_attach_0() {
00340     _base_attach(zerodata());
00341 }

00343 size_t log10_bits(size_t bits) {
00344     assert(std::numeric_limits<boost::intmax_t>::digits >= 32);
00345     const boost::intmax_t large_step(1000000000), small_step(10);
00346     const size_t count_per_large_step = 9, count_per_small_step = 1;
00347     integer n(pow2(bits)-1);
00348 
00349     size_t r = 0;
00350     while (n >= large_step) { n /= large_step; r += count_per_large_step; }
00351     while (n >= small_step) { n /= small_step; r += count_per_small_step; }
00352     return r;
00353 }
